description.narrative: The food security situation in Somaliland is one of the worst in the world due to draught and extreme poverty. Somaliland is mostly arid desert scrublands and less than 10 per cent of its area is arable land. Bad availability of factors of production, des troyed infrastructure and poor know-how restrict the already low agriculture. In addition to agriculture also other possibilities of making a living are poor. The project aims to improve methods that increase the soil fertility and solutions that support adaptation to the climate change. Two communities, Haleeya and Jaleelo, participate to the project. The expected results of the project are: the crop production capacity of the household level is increased, the capacity of farmer?s co-operatives is improv ed, value addition businesses is increased in target villages and the livestock productivity is improved. The two ISF?s food security projects are implemented in close co-operation with two organizations. The final beneficiaries of the project in 2015 are about 160 families and 21 per cent of the beneficiaries are women. The project in Maroodi Jeex region is implemented by ISF?s long-term local partner organization Candlelight fot Health, Environment and Education (CLHE).
